intro: Elaeoluma crispa, commonly known as the crinkled elaeoluma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, crinkled leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Elaeoluma crispa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
